meanings.definition: Having the power to influence or control
meanings.sent1: Her swayful words convinced everyone to join the project.
meanings.sent2: The leader's swayful decisions guided the team to success.
meanings.sent3: The cat's swayful meows made the dog follow it around.
meanings.sent4: The magician's swayful gestures captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's swayful presence commanded respect in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a gentle rocking or swaying motion
meanings.sent1: The swayful boat rocked peacefully on the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: The swayful branches of the tree danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The swayful hammock was the perfect spot for an afternoon nap.
meanings.sent4: The swayful motion of the swing brought back childhood memories.
meanings.sent5: The swayful rhythm of the music lulled her to sleep.
